data.title: JEFFREY MICHAEL GORDON
data.text:
JEFF GORDON

Jeff's New Look for the Winston

I'll admit, before I started this page, I checked out other JeffGordon fan created webpages. For an idea or two....just basically to see what other fans were doing. And I'll admit that I saw basically nothing I liked. I did check out an Anti-Jeff Gordon page while I was out surfing. I wanted to see their 'excuses' for why Jeff Gordon "sucks". I, of course, did not find one legitimate excuse.They did mention the fact that Jeff had 'pushed' his way to the front a few times.....you tell me one driver who has not pushed another car out of his way on the last lap when it meant winning....EXACTLY......

O'kae I'm off of my soap box now....ANYWAY...

LETS GO JEFF!!!

STATS....

Jeffrey Michael Gordon was born in Vallejo, California on August 4th,1971

His step-father's name is John Bickford

His mother's name is Carol

His sister's name is Kim

His step-brother's name is John Bickford Jr.

Jeff's biological father is Will Gordon.

Will & Carol were divorced when Jeff was only 3 month's old.

Jeff's favorite food is Italian

His interests include Fitness,movies,video games and water sports

Favorite charities include Racing for a Reason, Make a Wish Foundation and The Marrow Foundation

On with Jeff's career Stats....

His Car is #24

The name of his favorite Race Car is "Butthead"

It is the car that he used to win both Rockingham races in 1998.

Jeff names all of his cars starting with the letter "B"

His all time favorite car was called BOB.

BOB met a sorry demise during a practice run in Michigan in 1997.

Car Owner is Rick Hendrick

Crew Chief is Robbie Loomis

Loomis replaces Whitesell for 2000 season

Brian Whitesell re-placed Ray Evernham on September 29,1999

His sponsor is DuPont Refinishes

His Team's Motto is Refuse to Lose

Jeff was Busch Grand National Rookie of the Year in 1991

Richard Petty's last race was Jeff Gordon's first

In 1993, Jeff became NASCAR Winston Cup Rookie of the Year

In 1994, He won the inaugural BrickYard 400 on August 6th at Indianapolis

Jeff won the Busch Pole Award in 1995 & 1996

In 1997, He won the Winston Million Bonus. The only other one to do that in the history of the award was Bill Elliott

Also in 1997, The 1-2-3 finish at Daytona 500, Jeff set a record for becoming the youngest driver to win the Daytona 500.

Jeff Gordon, is the youngest champion in the modern era of NASCAR Winston Cup Racing

Finished 43rd place at The Texas Motor Speedway on March 28, 1999. The first 43rd place finish of his career

Jeff was the only driver in the 1999 season to qualify in the first round for all the events

On July 25, 2000...Jeff set an all-time NASCAR record for 6 straight road course wins

..Jeff.was named, NASCAR WINSTON CUP CHAMPION....

1995 1997 1998 2001
